Package InfrastructureManager.ModuleManagement

Class ModuleManager

java.lang.Object
InfrastructureManager.ModuleManagement.ModuleManager
public class ModuleManager
extends java.lang.Object
Class that allows to create, connect and manipulate the modules of the platform. This class is in charge of managing creation and connection of modules based on raw configuration data It also provides an interface for controlling module's lifecycles allowing to: - Start all modules (or a particular one) - Pause all running modules (or a particular one) - Resume all pause modules (or a particular one) - Stop all modules (or a particular one)

  • Constructor Details

    • ModuleManager

      public ModuleManager()
      Constructor of the class. Creates a new Module Manager object. Initializes the modules list.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize​(ModulesConfigurationFileData data)
      Initializes the manager based on raw data representing modules. This method shoulb be called directly after creating an object of this class, otherwise causing faulty behavior (Exception). It creates the modules using a ModuleFactory and connects them using a ModuleConnector
      Parameters:
      data - Raw data representing Modules and Connections

    • isInitialized

      public boolean isInitialized()
      Checks if the manager is initialized (the initialize() method was called)
      Returns:
      True if the manager is initialized, false otherwise.

    • getModules

      public java.util.List<PlatformModule> getModules() throws ModuleManagerException
      Returns the created and connected modules of the platform
      Returns:
      A list of modules of the platform
      Throws:
      ModuleManagerException - If the manager has not been initialized

    • exitAllModules

      public void exitAllModules()
      Allows for stopping and exiting execution in all currently running modules.

    • stopModule

      public void stopModule​(java.lang.String moduleName) throws ModuleNotFoundException
      Stops a running module
      Parameters:
      moduleName - Name of the module to stop.
      Throws:
      ModuleNotFoundException - If a module with the passed name could not be found inside the platform's modules

    • startAllModules

      public void startAllModules()
      Allows for starting all modules defined in the platform

    • startModule

      public void startModule​(java.lang.String moduleName) throws ModuleNotFoundException
      Starts a module. If called on a running module, restarts it.
      Parameters:
      moduleName - Name of the module to start
      Throws:
      ModuleNotFoundException - If a module with the passed name could not be found inside the platform's modules

    • pauseModule

      public void pauseModule​(java.lang.String moduleName) throws ModuleNotFoundException
      Pauses a running module. If called on a paused module has no effect
      Parameters:
      moduleName - Name of the module to pause
      Throws:
      ModuleNotFoundException - If a module with the passed name could not be found inside the platform's modules

    • pauseAllModules

      public void pauseAllModules()
      Allows to pause all running modules. Only affects running modules

    • resumeModule

      public void resumeModule​(java.lang.String moduleName) throws ModuleNotFoundException
      Resumes a paused module. If called on a running module has no effect
      Parameters:
      moduleName - Name of the module to be paused
      Throws:
      ModuleNotFoundException - If a module with the passed name could not be found inside the platform's modules

    • resumeAllModules

      public void resumeAllModules()
      Allows to resume all paused modules
